content: App works great. The only thing I would really like to see is the ability to show trends over a period of days rather than a single day. I'd love to look at a week trend and then narrow down results based on that.

I've had this device for about 3 years, gotta say i love the design and the idea. Unfortunately this is where the good things about this product end. This device is for pretty looks only, it is total garbage when it comes to doing it's job well, sensor readings are way off, even simple, basic things like temperature are off by 3-4 F, dust sensor is unreliable, i have compared it's readings against 5 other dust sensors of high quality. VOC is only good to note something has changed, and so on..

Has all of the air quality information I need and can connect to my devices. Down side is that it does not provide any information about how to optimally position and setup the connected devices (like a fan) to improve the quality of the air.

Overall informative and helpful. But most of the tips require action from you rather than tying into your existing smart thermostat. That's the biggest limiting factor by far to it's usefulness. That would make it incredibly useful without thinking

A very helpful device. I do wish there was a way to control the score as do not find each metric valuable. As my son has bad allergies, I utilize this device as a metric to mitigate what is triggering his reactions.
Great
You don't need to know my birthday and have access to my contacts. You are AN AIR MONITOR. Why is that mandatory?!
Edit: Yay dark mode!!
Updates now provided with details. --- The devs keep putting out updates with zero details about what is being done so this merits zero stars.
App is finally becoming useful. Long road, nice not to not have crashes. After 2 years the app just stopped connecting to my awair. The awair still has signal and is sending data. It's 100% the app!
This really helps me a lot and to keeping my hair clean and monitoring it Benefits me a lot I highly recommend this
The app is kinda useless if your Awair won't stay connected to the internet.
It's OK. I get more use out of the room temperature & humidity. I could get this at any electronics retailer for about $40 or so, with Bluetooth...

Huge potential here but the app is a bit limited. Pet peeve: on the trending charts, it *really* needs a 12 or 24 hour look back. Having Yesterday and Today seems like such a punt. For me, I have great interest in what goes on with my household air quality overnight. Also, the VOC readings are continuously paradoxical. I can't tell you how many hours I've spent trying to figure out what these mean. They range from 300 to 6000 in a matter of minutes sometimes, and back down. ???
Works well. Device is reporting high chemicals in the air. Another device shows chemicals to be in an acceptable range.
Decent app. Slow to load, and widget barely works, but those are more issues of BLE and Android than this app, itself.
Login working again. Very nice device.
Couldn't sign up for an account, I reached out and received a response promptly. There was a error with the app, which they were able to fix quickly.
Cannot sign up - help! The app gives me an error when trying to create an account. I tried FB, Google, and creating an account normally. All fail. Just received device today.

After having reset my awair 2nd edition, I am unable to connect to it via Bluetooth in order to set it up. The blue light on the device keeps on blinking and the Android app cycles on "Find awair" forever. It must be a software issue since I can manually pair with the awair via Bluetooth. Also, the buzzing noise of the device that no longer seems to go away on its own.
No problems and intuitive

Ok app. Nice device. Stylish. However you can not down load data. And it seams not to be able to store data. Thus when you are not nearby you loose all of that data for the day. I really want to love it but there are better options out there
Very nosy Seems to want a lot of info unrelated to its purpose - also would probably not have bought it if I had known that it needs always-on wifi
I will not connect to the device
Very difficult to get set up. Took many many times starting over. Said it was connected to network but wouldn't continue to next step.
Excellent so far. Would be great if the device could cycle between selected information, and not only show one thing. Pls consider this update.
Graphing function fixed.

Edit: Third time I'm rating this app, gave it 1 star the first two times because of issues connecting to my awair. The app is now pretty damn solid, no trouble connecting at all. Kudos to the developers for continuing to improve the app.
Graphing functions stopped working today

Needs more customization. The default target temperature doesn't make sense for everyone. People with illness are going to want the temperature to be higher, and this shouldn't decrease the overall air quality score.

As other reviewers have mentioned, the Awair is buggy. Sometimes the settings you set in the app don't get pushed to the device. Also, if the Awair is controlled with multiple phones/devices, the settings don't synchronize across all devices.

The app works reasonably well. The device (a glow c) seems to keep disconnecting from wifi, or something. It is on, and the wireless router is on, but it randomly stops sending data at least twice a day. It would be good if there were additional troubleshooting, especially that could connect via Bluetooth locally.
Look

Great. Many indoor air monitor track TVOC (you can smell anyways) but no Co²(tf?). I shut windows when air pollution is severe, but without airflow co² build up quite quickly; I get sleepy then nauseous at ~1500ppm+, so notifications is great for my small room. Alas alerts are audible enough & sounds like a duck, but IFTT is avaliable though. Update 13/08/2019 A year later, widget still lack dark theme option. Latest update also made widget width non-sizable. boo, RIP my screen real estate 🤦🏻

Impossible to connect the device to the internet. After trying for more than 3 hours, I decided to return the sensor. I should have read the app reviews before buying. Now I'm sure all the 5 star Amazon reviews were just fake... :(
"The app doesn't even work with newer android versions" I tried connecting to a galaxy s7 and it STILL didnt work. ZERO STARS!

The setup was smooth. It works as intended. Still not sure about the accuracy of the readings since i dont have anything else to compare against. The reason why im taking off 1 star is because i was not able to successfully connect to nest througj the app. At the last screen where you have to select the trigger (CO2 > 800 for ex), i cannot scroll down to click the save button.

The app does what it's supposed to do. I like the graphs it displays the pollutant levels throughout the day. Other than that, nothing extra ordinary. The integration with Nest lacks polish though. Everytime I need to sign in to Nest and re-authorize it to change settings.
Edit* Update 4.0.2 killed connections to units. Awair fixed bug in 24 hours with Update 4.0.4. Good to know Awair are on top of things, and read reviews - keep up the good work, much appreciated.

Really like this thing. Reviewing app and device here. Device is elegant enough that my wife complimented it without knowing what it was - wow - and the app is simple to use. I haven't had any of the app crash issues others are complaining about. I don't have a way to validate the accuracy of anything except the temperature and humidity, but both agree with other devices in the house
App is completely broken, won't let me press the log in button.
works well and seems accurate.

It is outrageous that it doesn't work with the latest version of Android. The app doesn't even ask for permission to use Bluetooth, so it's impossible to set up your device. They should put a warning on the website and anywhere Awair devices are sold so that people know not to buy. I was lucky to have an old phone lying around that I could set it up with.  The app's notifications are very aggressive. It tells you every time any attribute of the air changes in any way, i.e. every few minutes. The only viable option is to completely disable all notifications.  It also desperately needs to be possible to set preferences for temperature. The temperature in my home is 16°C, which I consider to be the perfect temperature, but the Awair's 5 star rating considers it to be the 2nd worst and gives me a million tips on how to make it warmer. If I wanted it warmer I would put the heating on. I am sitting in my underwear and it is perfect for sleep. The suggested 22-26°C is insane, that's hotter than summer and I am unable to sleep at that temperature.  Temperature is a preference, and varies by age or sex, so I don't need a company decreeing that the temperature is "unsafe" in my home.
aweful. app can't find the unit.
An incredibly invasive app that wants to know everything about you before you're allowed to use the device that you paid hundreds of dollars for. Why?

I want to like this product, but after over a year of usage I realized that this company does not do a good job. I first encountered lost wifi connection days after acquiring the device. The website blamed "your router" or "your connection". After switching router and cable modem, I still got lost wifi issue AND I did not see improvements on their website help as well as the app, I realized I bought a bad product. Notice that I used Ring and Nest products and they all worked well.
Changing my review. App and unit work great. I'm in day 2.

my awair glow doesnt connect with my router using latest ddwrt router software. the $200 awair intermittantly connects with router usig same software. Today, my sleep report was inaccurate with times being reported.
If I do aromatherapy it reports bad air quality.
Great features and plenty of information!
after the new update it started working fine. no network connection issue.

This app asks for wayyy too much personal information. I bought an air quality monitor, had a great unboxing experience, nice-looking device, then download the app and before I can even get going I have to sign up, confirm my email, grant access to my location for some reason, and then provide my name, age, and then even gender (though gender was optional)... After the obstacle course, I could finally add a device, but then it wanted to add it to my wifi, and scans keep crashing the app. Great.
do not support oreo and above..cant understand why this app giving updates again?

after using this for a couple of years I been upgraded my Wi-Fi network only two discover that this no longer works with Android 8. So while it was a somewhat useful device it is now simply a brick on my shelf. How a company could not support the operating system of 80% of smartphones around the world is beyond me. I probably will just throw it away.

Edit: Connection issue has been resolved. Will provide a more indepth review of the app down the road after I've had more time with it. Thanks.  Stopped working this afternoon, won't load. Just spins when opening app, even after closing and restarting app. Not sure if app related, or server backend related. Very frustrating...
app stopped working this afternoon, just keeps spinning
On-going issues with Nest Integration. No response from Awair support.
Sleek app & fast patches by developers.

The app works as intended. It's simple to use and has some good information on how to improve your air quality when the awair device is reading bad stuff. Runs flawlessly on my note 9 running Android 8.
A solid application with an excellent widget, but it would be nice to control where optimal is for temperature, and what goes on the widget. Works great on Android Pie!
It just doesn't work with 8.0. I set it up with an iPhone, and still can't connect with my Android running 8.0. I have no other problems with Bluetooth connectivity, just with the Await.
I bought this unit today and cannot use it because it doesn't work on android what a waste of money and terrible business from this company
Very useful and precise readings from the unit, intuitive to use app, A+

By their own admission, this app does not work with android 8.0 for setup. You need to use an iphone for setup, then supposedly android will work. If you don't have access to an iphone tough. I spend $400 on two awair units and they say, sorry, we don't feel like keeping our app working with your phone. Their response: "After exploring several options, we were unable to develop a patch to fix the issues introduced with Android 8.0. Unfortunately, this version of Android's operating system is currently incompatible with Awair."

Too many notifications. Overall I like the app and the device. This comment is meant to be constructive feedback for the devs. I want notifications if there is a significant deterioration in my house air quality. But right now I am receiving 3-5 notifications per day for every little deterioration or improvement. Unfortunately You can only have notifications ON or OFF. I don't want notifications for every little change BUT I do want notifications for significant deterioration. I would suggest also adding a threshold setting to, say, notify my only when the quality goes into the red or the amber that way I can receive notifications only when the air deteriorates significantly... Or for every little change. Air Visual app and/or Plume do this well. I would suggest checking them out.
Love it. But please add month/year to weekly view as we scan history.

The latest App updates all you to set 'below' triggers for IFTTT which is great. I can now control my IQAir purifier that I have connected via a TP Link smartplug to turn both on or off based on dust or VOC levels. Keep up the good work. Keeps on getting better

App is generally good and easy to use. It already prompted me to reduce CO2. However, I'm removing a star for the setup and then another for the insufficient lighting controls... I setup an Awair Glow and had to kill the app twice to proceed. Once after creating an account. App signed in only after restarting. Second time was after adding the Awair. It would not appear until after a restart... Second star removed is because the led dimming doesn't do anything on my Glow and there's no way to turn off the wifi interference lighting. I bought this for a bedroom, but can't keep it there because of the occasional blinking.
App complains about network connectivity problems, but all other apps work fine. The Awair app works on my old phone though.
The app does what it is supposed to do, but why is it 109MB?
just gza
The info is fine, the nest integration is buggy. The support is great

Graphs never update. I can't change the settings to display the clock. The 
concept is nice, but the awair doesn't seem to hold on well on my wifi 
connection. Other connected devices have no problem on my wifi.

Fantastic device and app! Issues from previous update were responded to and 
fixed within a day or two. Great job developers! Thanks for listening to 
customer feedback and responding so quickly!
Not workable on android 8

I'm so happy with the glow, I bought a second for my bedroom. When the 
first was in transit I saw the warning about android 8.0, luckily I have an 
old tablet laying around so figured I could do the work around and be fine. 
Shockingly I was able to easily pair both of the glows using my 8.0 note 8. 
It was simple and the app is great! My air quality I'm this old house is 
much better than I imagined.
Bad app

The app doesn't work. The product will not connect to my Google Pixel 2 XL  via Bluetooth at all. Multiple other devices like my Fitbit work perfectly. Please avoid this product, it is currently broken.  Edit: After reading around the net and hundreds of other upset customer accounts, the way to do it is by finding an older Android device and then set it up via that OS instead. Once done, it will connect via WiFi and the interface becomes accessible on your current day technology.

Couldn't get past the first step of pairing. My pixel 2 andriod 8.1 did not 
connect, with fresh awair app, or factory reset on device.
it looks like a gaza.

As other users are also reporting, I was not able to set this thing up 
using the latest version of Android Oreo--which immediately makes it a nice 
looking $200 paperweight, unless you can find a compatible device to set it 
up. That's pretty unforgivable in my opinion, and I think Awair needs to 
get it's act together in this area. Maybe it's a device problem (Pixel 2 
XL) or Android issue (8.1.0), but if your not going to support the latest 
OS, you need to much more transparent about that... Fortunately I was able 
to easily set it up with my wife's iPhone, and everything has been working 
okay moving forward.

It will be better: 1-If you add an option to set the clock and every 30 min 
it show the other things like temperature, Co2. 2-If I can rotate the 
device and the clock too to be in the vertical postion. 3-To support many 
devices in the same time. 4-If I can write a small note to be shown in the 
device. Thanks.

Doesn't work with WEP Wi-Fi anymore after the patch since the "encryption 
is too weak", however unsecured is still okay. Stupid and inappropriate for 
an air monitor to dictate network security policy to it's customers. 1st 
one died after a few weeks, returned and 2nd is now a paperweight for me.

Why create a monitoring app without a widget? So cumbersome to launch the 
app and pick the device every time you want to check the air.

After awair's firmware has been updated to 1.77.50, my problem about clock 
mode is clear and I get more satisfaction about the product. About the app, 
disconnection issue still remains. Hope the company add more try to fix 
this problem.

Setup via Pixel 2 XL using Android 8.1 and it worked without any issues. I 
was able to set it up in less than 5 minutes. I don't work for awair, but I 
would consider buying stock in them when available. Amazing!

I want to access my data .. how can I do that.. I would like better 
integration to Google or Iftt.. all that insight and very little action or 
outcomes.. like what makes a high VOC level.. how do you get to that.. I 
feel like this device is collecting data for another purpose..

you cannot set the min values. needs more options. also VOC are not 
specified. temps are not accurate
Android 7.0, setup fails, different phones.  Don't buy.
Can't even register myself in the app
Can't even create an account? What's going on guys?
Watch out! Awair doesn't work with updated Android devices. There is no work around that doesn't using somebody else's phone either.
Wish it had the same attention/features that iOS receives. Widget, swipe between devices. Maybe one day.
Solid product,  needs more nest functions,  like ability to run heat or a.c. based on temp and humidity instead of just the fan.
I would like to be able to change the normal temperature range from 72°-78° to a more comfortable 66°- 72°. Seriously, who is actually more productive or sleeps better at 78°?!

Updating firmware does not fix setup issue. None of the suggested "workarounds" were compatible with any of our Android 8.1 or 8.0 devices. Borrowed an iOS device from someone else to get the device connected to WiFi, but then changed my SSID a week later and now unable to setup again despite the new firmware their support is touting to fix the issue.
Update: Nest integration been fixed and works very well now. Great to see things getting address and would recommend the product!

Finally a chance to update this:  Context: app literally didn't work for about 6 months rendering the device useless.  Hey this works now. I'm glad Awair figured out a solution that is so easy to use (on a Mac). Given that the app does not have the ability to actually pair with a device with the 1.0 firmware that caused the issue I cannot give it a 5 star rating. I'm sure there's some technical limitation out of awair's hands but the reality is the app won't work for some people, and will require some fnsggling to get to work.  Support was excellent throughout the process, glad you all figured this out.
Works well, just have to say that I did have to clean mine with compressed air.

Initial setup was a little confusing as I got in a login loop with the Google option. Is there a way to turn off notifications for this app? I don't want to be notified of changes to anything. Just be able to see them in the app. Also I would like to be able to configure the colored LED on my awair to only respond to Co2 changes and not humidity or temperature..
Works really well with monitor making it very convenient.
A great way to monitor in door air quality, with the associated device. The latest update has fixed most of the issues with the app.

The app is clean and provides useful information, but there is one major issue. I use the Glow's plug to automatically turn on my space heater based on a temperature trigger. But the app will not allow me to set a temperature higher than 22 degrees Celsius. While the app can warn users who attempt to set high temperature settings, the temperature triggers have to be fully user controllable instead of being locked to an upper limit to 22 C.
Not able to connect the hardware device from my newly purchased pixel 2 with Android 8.1. this problem makes device useless for me
Doesn't work with Nexus 6P, so hardware is useless to me.
Refused to create account with multiple attempts with password. No way to use hardware without account or app working. Completely broken
Won't create account, infinite stuck loop, useless hardware, will return to Amazon.  Tested on two phones pixel 2 and Samsung Galaxy 8.  Pre alpha app, non-functional
Does not work with Google Pixel 1. Apparently caused by a bug in Android Oreo 8.0.0. Useless app and device if you can't set it up... :/

The device looks extremely pleasant. Unfortunately I had to use another phone as Oreo (android 8.0) didn't allow me to connect to the device via Bluetooth. This is not awair's fault though since it is a general android oreo bug. Once you use another phone to do the initial pairing, you can use your oreo phone to connect to the app. The rest of the communication with the device is done over the wifi network.   Once paired, everything worked perfect. At least until I unplugged it and moved it to a different room. The VOC was stuck on -189 for a full day. And the wifi was very buggy (blinking purple dot every five minutes or so). Had to physically reset it in the end. It seemed like all the other measurements were also off in that period. Temperature dropped by ~4°C after the reset, CO2 shot up from 200 to 400 etc. The wifi problem also seems resolved now.  The reset seems to solve all these issues, but doesn't increase my confidence. Awair firmware version is 1.2.6 and the app version is 1.6.0.  The settings menu is also not completely clear. Display setting temp/hum doesn't seem to work. The knocking feature is also not really explained.
Still not working with Android 8.0. Devs blame it on the OS meanwhile I have ~15 other Bluetooth devices that connect without issues.

I have no idea why people are knocking this device. You won't find another Co2 meter for under $300. I have the pixel 2 and have no problem connecting through wifi. Absolutely love the historical data. My only wish is that I could set parameters to turn the plug OFF, not just ON. For example, turn on the fan when temp reaches 80, turn off the fan when temp reaches 65. Other than that, these units are great.
Not working on Oreo, app developer needs to push Google to do fix in step with it's users. Unit has been plugged in for a month and is ultimately useless.
Does not work with my pixel, 8.0.  fix it already!!!
Nothing better than spending $200 on a device with a broken app. Nov 6th and still not supporting Oreo? Not a company I'm going to trust with my $$
Can't connect at all, just keeps asking to try again. Got the same problem on iPhone as well.
not working with Oreo; I tried finding app on  apple store to see if it's any better. Apple store returns white screen No Results for "awair" ... I hope I can return the device.
Doesn't allow for setup of new device using Android 8.0

The Awair is awesome. I have four of them as I am a sensitive breather and a house I bought a year ago has some serious air quality issues. The app is continually improving, and the Awair team is responsive to feedback and enhancement suggestions.

Same issue as another, I have Nexus 6 running android Oreo, prior to upgrading when trying  to connect I kept getting 'wrong pin'. Now I upgraded when pairing I only get 'try again'. Have opened up a ticket... See what happens

Just got my Awair. Cannot connect to the unit. Simply says to try again. Never works. Device: Nexus 6P on Android O. Logcat states no devices found during ble scan. Very disappointed. It's a $179 paperweight.

Constantly crashing.  The functionality of the app is the main selling point of this device, however the only aspects that seem to work are initial setup, remote enabling the power socket, but when trying to look at the status, instant crash. You have to have the power button on to avoid the crash.

As others have reported, the app crashes all the time.   Want to change orientation? Crash.  Want to open the app from background? Crash. Want to open the app? Crash.  Changing through different data? Crash.   I was patient enough to wait for their update to support Awair glow for months.  What kind of development stack do you use? Any feature suggestion that I've made (some of which were already being worked on) hasn't made a dent.   If Awair is a IoT company, and isn't working on their App/Web App, what are they working on? Can we expect to see this app to work for next 5~10 years?   The product attached to it has been steady, and functional. But this product is nothing but nightlight if the app does not work.  Fix it.
Doesn't work on Android. You cannot connect to your devices.
Company is very responsive to feedback. Device appears to be accurate as long as cleaning instructions are followed.
App can't seem to find the Awair and connect after initial connection. I deleted the device but am having trouble reconnecting. Hangs up when trying to connect to Nest thermostat.

I had to use iOS to set up the app. It won't connect using Android and my account won't sync so awair is completely useless on droid. Fingers crossed for a fix.  Update- issue is fixed for Android. I love that it tells me the air quality in my toddlers bedroom.
Working very well with new version.  Thanks.

The app initially worked with my android device when I first purchased it, however it has been unable to locate the awair device via bluetooth for months. All trouble shooting options have not fixed the problem, and the app updates have failed to fix the issue.
The new weather comparison is great. Thank you.
Awair can help your indoor air. Awesome
Great solution but a bit buggy. Particularly when accessing awair Nest integration information.
I like accessing the detailed analysis from my Awair. The app finally links my Android phone with my Next thermostat. Now the fan kicks on automatically depending on CO2, VOC, and dust levels.
Latest updates brought major improvements. Awair Glow connectivity is working great. The app interface is clean, informative and very user friendly. Thanks for the solid update!
Works perfectly on Android Nougat with new update. Very satisfied now.
New update does not work with my Samsung galaxy 5. Does not display current air quality and connection.  A real pain!
앱 업데이트하니깐 많이바꼈네요. 버그도 사라지고 연동도 잘되요
The Awair Glow app works great! My account was already logged in and picked up the Glow right away. Thanks for the update. :-)
Finally Glow is connected by update
Easy to use, reliable connection.
App is great, no crashes or disconnects in over a month. Love the tips on how to improve score.
Awair Glow will not connect.
Not working. Keep showing 'disconnected' alert
Just awful in every way
The biggest thing I would like to see is temperature to the .1 of a degree. I know the device is capable it shows up in the charts but not in realtime.
Why does the iPhone app work fine and yet Google Pixel can't even connect to Awair properly? So unacceptable for a $200 device.
Does not work. Fix it please
It cannot find/connect glow awair....please update for android!!!!it connected to my wife's iphone!!useless for other platforms!!!not happy!

it worked for the first few months, but now it forgets it's login to the Awair account every day and has to be re-setup each day.  It also seems to have difficulty with hidden SSID and randomly disconnects from WiFi, unless  the SSID is advertised.
App doesn't even open on my Google Pixel phone.

I can't get it to complete linking to my Nest device, it shows it in the background but has the spinning circle dialogue continuously and will not allow me to select and complete. This happens on all of my android devices.
App doesn't work.  If you can't get an app to work I don't have any confidence that the hardware works either.  Returning tomorrow.
Crashes a lot, doesn't respond a lot, and logs me out at random times. When it works, nice info, though I wish vocs were list as tvoc instead of index. The device itself is ok too.

Nothing had been updated since April, logging into accounts is currently broken. Resetting passwords keeps the submit login button on the page. Only able to see current day info. Lots of disappointment for a $200 dollar gadget. Especially when customer service says they'll release new updates and fails to deliver.

App works well. Product is awesome. A couple things on my want list are historical data over 24 hours (even if there could be an advanced setting to enable some kind of logging to a server/database on the local network) and the raw ppb measure from the VOC sensor.
Working beautifully on Android
Simple and light app. Works perfectly on Android 5.0.1.

Ok, one star off just because of the "Designed for Phones" limitation, which is even more silly than normal since the timeline graphs would actually be more readable if you could turn your phone on its side, or use a tablet.  Another star off because you specify needing Android 4.3 or later, but I can't get it to install on any device not running Android 5.X.  Two tablets that run 4.4.2 can't install the app.
Great product, and what a lovely highly functional app!
Easy setup and simple design
And easy to use!
